meanings.definition: Feeling resentment at having been unfairly treated.
meanings.sent1: The aggrieved student felt upset about the unfair test results.
meanings.sent2: She looked aggrieved when she realized her friend had betrayed her trust.
meanings.sent3: The aggrieved puppy pouted when it didn't get a treat.
meanings.sent4: His aggrieved expression spoke volumes about his feelings of injustice.
meanings.sent5: The aggrieved customer demanded a refund after receiving poor service.

meanings.definition: Suffering from an injury or offense.
meanings.sent1: The aggrieved soldier limped back to camp after the battle.
meanings.sent2: The aggrieved cat licked its wounded paw tenderly.
meanings.sent3: The aggrieved tree branch groaned under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent4: The aggrieved car engine sputtered and stalled on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The aggrieved athlete winced in pain as he crossed the finish line.
